oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union Sgt. Elijah J. Pirkle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter was written by Sgt. Elijah J. Prikle, Co. G, 3rd Tenn. Cav. USA to his brother Jesse M. Pirkle of the same regiment. Jesse was captured at Sulphur Branch Trestle on September 25, 1864 and sent to Andersonville. Elijah was wounded September 10 near Florence, Alabama and sent to the hospital in Nashville. At the time the letter was written both brothers were waiting to be discharged from the army. The envelope is marked "soldier letter" which allowed it to be mailed without a postage stamp.
